articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.description: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
articles.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'

articles.description: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movement—until he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.
articles.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity

articles.description: Pierre-Nicolas Hurstel, CEO of Arianee, which offers enterprise software to consumer brands to help them launch NFTs tied to physical goods, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how much the NFT space is growing despite the bear market, how big consumer brands will take crypto mainstream, and how loyalty programs are going to be the next huge use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Arianee CEO: Big Consumer Brands Are Going to Take Web3 to 1 Billion Users

articles.description: Salesforce's Web3 lead Marc Mathieu sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the CRM giant's crypto strategy, why "we had to" embrace Web3, and why the crypto wallet is "the new cookie" online.
articles.title: Salesforce Web3 Lead: Every Brand's Web Site Will Support Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Doodles CEO Julian Holguin, former president of Billboard, sat down with Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the strong vibes at the event and the importance of IRL meetups in Web3, what's next for Doodles and the community, and his prediction that many newer projects won't survive the crypto winter.
articles.title: Doodles CEO: Why In-Person Meetups Are Crucial for NFT Communities

articles.description: SuperRare co-founder Jon Perkins sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the debate over artist royalties, SuperRare's roots in catering to artists, and building through a bear market.
articles.title: SuperRare Co-Founder: We Remain Committed to NFT Artist Royalties

articles.description: Avalanche founder and Ava Labs CEO Emin Gun Sirer has been working on proof-of-work cryptocurrencies since before Bitcoin (seriously). He talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about how Avalanche avoided FTX and how much damage SBF has done to crypto’s image with VCs, why institutions still aren’t backing away from crypto, why Avalanche will succeed in the long run, and trying to cater to both Wall Street institutions and DeFi degens. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Meet the Brain Behind Avalanche

articles.description: Sebastien Borget, founder and COO of the metaverse realm The Sandbox, sat down wit Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the future of the open metaverse and true digital ownership, what's next for The Sandbox, and its current user numbers and stats.
articles.title: Founder of The Sandbox: 'Essential' to Metaverse That Users Own Their Digital Content

articles.description: Playboy's Web3 lead Liz Suman sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to tell the story of how the 70-year-old magazine brand got into Web3 and preview its upcoming MetaMansion in The Sandbox, which will give special access privileges to those with a Playboy Rabbitar NFT.
articles.title: Playboy's Next Step in Web3: MetaMansion in The Sandbox

articles.description: Dave Broome, CEO of NFT design and production studio Orange Comet, spoke to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how his company takes "large, popular IP" and turns it into NFT content and Web3 worlds around it.
articles.title: Orange Comet CEO: 'We're Trying to Build the Disney of Web3'

articles.description: Worldwide Webb is a gaming realm that lets you turn your NFT PFPs (Punks, Apes, Doodles and so on) into playable avatars. Founder Thomas Webb spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how the game works, the $10m Series A funding it just received, and why he expects we'll soon see NFT games that show what NFT gaming can do in its best form.
articles.title: Worldwide Web Founder: What NFT Gaming 'Should Be and Will Be'

articles.description: Animoca Brands chairman Yat Siu spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the open metaverse, NFTs and gaming, building through a bear market, and why Animoca believes the future of the industry is culture and gaming.
articles.title: Yat Siu of Animoca Brands: 'The Future of Crypto and Web3 Is Culture'

articles.description: Shiti Manghani, COO of Stepn, the app that lets users earn tokens for exercising, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about Stepn's current health, its plans to addnew achievement systems for the top users, and parent company Finding Satoshi Labs and its plans to launch more apps.
articles.title: COO of Move-to-Earn App STEPN: 'We're Thriving, Not Just Surviving'

articles.description: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industry’s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygon’s Winning Streak

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
Grayscale’s CEO as well as owners Digital Currency Group and Barry Silbert allegedly violated trust agreements, according to the lawsuit.
Alameda Research Ltd., the hedge fund belonging to disgraced ex-billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried, is suing Grayscale Investments, LLC, its CEO, Michael Sonnenshein, and its owners, Digital Currency Group and Barry Silbert as a debtor affiliate of FTX.
According to a press release announcing the lawsuit, “FTX Debtors are seeking injunctive relief to unlock $9 billion or more in value for shareholders of the Grayscale Bitcoin and Ethereum Trusts (the "Trusts") and realize over a quarter billion dollars in asset value for the FTX Debtors' customers and creditors.” 
The release describes how Grayscale has “extracted” more than $1.3 billion in management fees wh…
articles.title: FTX Debtors Sue Grayscale Investments And Its Executives

articles.author: George Kaloudis
articles.description: Call it Choke Point 2.0, debanking or whatever, the crypto industry’s problems with the banking industry show why the banking industry needs reform.
articles.title: Crypto’s Banking Problem Is Not Ironic

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
Terawulf, a bitcoin mining operation, has announced that it has energized the first nuclear-powered bitcoin mining facility in the United States at the company’s Nautilus Facility in Pennsylvania. According to the company, approximately 1 exahash per second (EH/s) or close to 8,000 application-specific integrated circuit (ASIC) bitcoin miners are now online, and another 8,000 mining rigs will be delivered shortly.
 
Nuclear-Powered Bitcoin Mining — A Milestone for Carbon-Free Bitcoin Mining
 
Terawulf announced on Monday that the first behind-the-meter bitcoin mining facility powered by nuclear energy has been energized, with nearly 8,000 ASIC mining rigs now operational. The current 8,000 account for 1 EH/s of SHA256 hashpower, but Terawulf expects to deploy another 8,000 miners in the co…
articles.title: Terawulf Energizes First Nuclear-Powered Bitcoin Mining Facility in the US, Plans to Expand Operations

articles.author: Cheyenne Ligon

articles.title: SEC Accuses Utah-Based Green United of Running $18M Crypto Mining Scam

articles.author: Dennis Porter
articles.description: Bitcoin mining should be hailed as an effective tool for a lower emissions future, not demonized as monkey wrench in the works.
articles.title: Bitcoin Mining Is Good for the Energy Grid and Good for the Environment

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
Amid the several downturns in the crypto market, including the Silvergate fallout and regulatory crackdown, the U.S.-based cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has unveiled its plans to launch a banking institution.
 
This was revealed by Marco Santori, Kraken’s Chief Legal Officer, in a podcast with The Block. This update comes when the crypto industry is experiencing a downtrend due to negative news from Silvergate and several backlashes from regulators.
 
Kraken To Launch Its Own Bank
 
Marco on the Scoop Podcast says a plan to launch the first industry-focused bank is coming. The chief legal officer added:
 

Kraken Bank is very much on track to launch, very soon, We’re going to have those pens with the little ball chains. We’re going to order thousands of them and attach them to the desks o…
articles.title: Kraken Exchange Unveils Plan To Launch Bank Amid Regulatory Crackdown

articles.title: Tether's USDT Stablecoin Market Share Rises to Highest Level in 15 Months

articles.description: As it stands, there’s no way for people to know which crypto firms they can rely on, said Michael Hsu, the acting head of the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), in a speech Monday.
articles.title: U.S. Banking Watchdog: You Can’t Trust Crypto Firms Until They Get Federal Oversight

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Data shows Bitcoin funding rates have turned negative recently, suggesting that shorts are accumulating on the market. Will a squeeze follow?
 
Bitcoin Funding Rates Are At Their Most Negative Since December 2022
 
As an analyst in a CryptoQuant post pointed out, the market sentiment is currently turning bearish. The relevant indicator here is the “funding rate,” which measures the periodic fee that long and short traders on the futures market are currently exchanging with each other.
 
When the value of this metric is positive, it means long holders are currently paying a premium to the short holders to keep their positions. Such a trend suggests the majority of traders are bullish right now.
 
On the other hand, the indicator’s negative value implies the shorts pay the fee. Naturally, th…
articles.title: Bitcoin Shorts Are Piling Up, Liquidation Squeeze Soon?

articles.author: Nelson Wang
articles.description: The bankrupt trading firm is seeking injunctive relief to allow FTX debtors to realize what it claims is more than $250 million in asset value.
articles.title: Alameda Sues Grayscale and DCG to Allow Redemptions, Reduce Fees

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The Rollkit development team has announced that Bitcoin has been integrated as a means for sovereign rollups to store and retrieve data. The developers have stated that it is now possible to run the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) on Bitcoin as a sovereign rollup. However, some Ethereum proponents have expressed dissatisfaction with the technology being referred to as a rollup, and have suggested that the team should avoid using the term.
 
Rollkit’s Modular Framework for Rollups and Its Potential Impact on the Blockchain Industry
 
On March 5, 2023, developers announced a new development that claims it is now possible to produce sovereign rollups to store and retrieve data using the Bitcoin blockchain. The team behind the project is Rollkit developers, who detailed that the technology allo…
articles.title: Rollkit Developers Leverage Bitcoin for Sovereign Rollups, Sparking Criticism from Ethereum Proponents

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
For some folks, cryptocurrencies are complex and high-risk assets, which makes them hard to comprehend despite their potential. This limitation has posed challenges for several governments while seeking regulatory clarity for crypto. The same issue has been weighing on Australian authorities planning to release clear legislation for cryptocurrencies.
 
 
According to a new report, the Australian Treasury Department revealed a new timeline for crypto legislation in the country. The internal document noted that releasing Australia’s crypto legislation could extend beyond 2024, as the government wants to study the industry extensively before making decisions.
 
Decisions Regarding Australian Crypto Legislations Could Take Time
 
The Australian Financial Review obtained some documents under th…
articles.title: Possible Timeline For Australia’s Crypto Legislation Revealed

articles.title: GBTC Discount Narrows to 42% Ahead of Grayscale’s ETF Hearing Tuesday

articles.description: Hany Rashwan, co-founder of the Zug, Switzerland-based ETP provider, says bitcoin’s price is being driven by more macro economic factors, including inflation and East Asian traffic.
articles.title: 21.co CEO Sees ‘No Material’ Impact on Bitcoin Following Silvergate’s SEN Platform Closure

articles.author: Nicholas Anthony
articles.description: Nigerians are protesting their country's CBDC and demanding renewed access to paper money, despite government incentives to use the digital currency.
articles.title: Nigerians’ Rejection of Their CBDC Is a Cautionary Tale for Other Countries

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
With the bear market deepening and causing ups and downs in the Bitcoin market every now and then, the piecing together of significant adoption news to come up with a conclusion that maybe the bear season was a distraction after all is something that is often overlooked. 
 
On March 4, prominent crypto Youtuber and influencer Lark Davis decided to think outside the box to piece up all major corporate adoption in order to back up his belief that what could happen following the 2024 Bitcoin (BTC) halving “will blow people’s minds.”
 
Increasing Corporate Crypto Adoption
 
Lark Davis, in a series of tweets published March 4, did not only try to make a point about the bear market but also made a list of major adoptions to back up the point. 
 
To start off, the Influencer tweeted, “Don’t let t…
articles.title: Why This Analyst Believes Bitcoin Will Blow People’s Minds In 2025

articles.author: Media
articles.description:
PRESS RELEASE. London – Alvey Chain, a decentralized Layer 2 Blockchain built on Ethereum Chain, also a leading provider of blockchain technology solutions, is proud to announce the launch of its next-generation Virtual Reality Multiverse Exchange. The new platform offers a secure, reliable, and scalable solution for users. They can trade, open as many as 50 charts, use various indicators, manage their wallets all while having an immersive experience.
 
The Alvey Chain platform is built on a highly scalable architecture that can handle thousands of transactions per second, making it ideal for businesses of all sizes. The platform features a powerful consensus mechanism that ensures the integrity and security of transactions, as well as advanced smart contract functionality that enables bus…
articles.title: Alvey Chain Introduces World’s First Next-Generation Virtual Reality Multiverse Exchange

articles.author: Cheyenne Ligon
articles.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) was granted emergency relief by a Florida court on Monday to freeze and appoint a receiver for the assets of Miami-based crypto hedge fund BKCoin and one of its co-founders, Kevin Kang.
articles.title: SEC Files Emergency Action Against BKCoin for Running $100M ‘Ponzi-like’ Scheme

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
A joint venture with Cumulus Coin, LLC. has brought the first nuclear-powered Bitcoin mine online in Pennsylvania.
Terawulf has announced roughly half of its nuclear-powered Nautilus Cryptomine has come online. The mining facility, a joint venture with Cumulus Coin, LLC., derives its energy wholly from the 2.5 GW Susquehanna nuclear generation station in Pennsylvania.
The full operation will amount to 50 MW and 1.9 EH/s, with an option for Terawulf to add an additional 50 MW of bitcoin mining capacity, “which the Company plans to deploy in future phases,” according to a press release. 
Paul Prager, chairman and CEO of TeraWulf, said that “the recent energization of the Nautilus facility earlier this month, approximately 16,000 of TeraWulf’s owned miners, representing 1.9 EH/s of self-mining capacity, are onsite and being brought online daily.” 
“The Nautilus nuclear-powered mining facility benefits from what is arguably the lowest cost power in the sector, just $0.02/kWh for a term of five years,” Prager commented.
Mining consultant and cofounder of Citadel 256, Magdalena Gronowska, previously described in an article for Bitcoin Magazine how nuclear power can revolutionize Bitcoin mining.
“Nuclear is a carbon free, reliable and cheap energy source,” she told the magazine. “It's not perfect in that it emits nuclear waste, but every energy source has tradeoffs between environmental footprint, reliability and capital and operating costs… We need a diverse mix of energy generation, to serve both baseload and peak load, as we transition to a low carbon economy.”
articles.title: Terawulf Brings First Fully Nuclear-Powered Bitcoin Mining Operation In America Online
